Class Pawn

  • java.lang.Object
    • schach.model.Piece
      • schach.model.Pawn
  • public class Pawn
extends Piece
    Class Pawn representing the chess piece peasant

      • checkAhead

        private void checkAhead​(int column,
                        int row)
        checks if starting move (2 squares ahead) and basic move (1 square ahead) are valid if so adds it to list of valid squares
        Parameters:
        column - integer representation of the column the pawn is currently occupying
        row - integer representation of the row the pawn is currently occupying

      • checkEnPassantRight

        public java.util.List<Square> checkEnPassantRight()
        Checks if a 'en passant' move is possible, if so returns a list of squares that the pawn would move to if it made a 'en passant' move
        Returns:
        target squares as a result of a 'en-passant' move TODO return just a single square - its never possible that two en-passant moves are possible
